title: PSA Lock in or Dodge
body:
http://i.imgur.com/CtNw6Bb.jpg

To keep Champ select quick, every ban and pick now requires you to lock in. If you don't, everyone's kicked back to position select and you'll face queue dodge penalties

replies.body: What is the purpose of this, I find that too many times I dont lock in or ban. Your summs dont stay when it dodges. Please change it to benefit us all.

I hear ya man its annoying when people forget to press the lock in button.

But to keep Champ select quick, every ban and pick now requires you to lock in. If you don't, everyone's kicked back to position select and you'll face queue dodge penalties

Especially because the process itself has a few extra steps like pick intent, 1 ban from 3 diferent players, and players pick 1 at a time. Once everyone gets used to it the champ select process will be a lot quicker and smoother than it used to be.

I think it's a great system man. It may have taken me 90 minutes to get in to a game this morning, but I see the merit in the system. Perhaps the UI could have been designed to be a bit more idiot proof (have a voice saying lock in choice now at 10 seconds remaining or something) as I imagine most people would just click the "never show again" box for initial warning.

Loving the pick intent, loving having to lock in for bans....overall I'm psyched for this season. And finally I don't have to draw straws when I'm playing with two or more friends :)

This is bullshit, so people need to wait an extra 10 seconds, is making them wait really something so bad that you should kick all 10 people over?

what happens to those people who change champions at the last second? do they get penalised because they couldn't lock in their second choice as well in that last 1 second?
making people lose their promos just because they forgot to press 'lock in' (when every single other queue does it for you) is complete BS
i actually feel like waiting the full timer and only locking in at the last second now just to make a point.

but apart from that single pointless factor, the champion select looks pretty good, it will get rid of that one last pick guy who suddenly somehow doesn't know how to play any other position but top and even when he doesn't get it the only champion he has is Nasus...

Its easy.
I like it.
Recording my provisional games too.
Just becuase I wanna see my end score.
Right now Im 3 wins, 1 Loss.

I don't understand people that don't get this. You click a button, how hard is that? How is that 2 extra seconds of effort a gamechanger?
If I had to take a stab at why this was implemented, I'd say it's to stop people from selecting their champ then buggering off to make a sandwich or something. And I'm totally fine with that. If you can't put in the effort to spend 3 minutes watching your screen, clicking the required buttons, and actually communicating with your teammates, then you shouldn't be in the Ranked queue in the first place.

PSA: Ban people who don't check their ping before joining a Ranked game or have something in the client that checks players' internet connections and disables ranked if they don't meet certain criteria.

I used to literally only play Ranked during the middle of week days on my days off from uni because I KNEW that I would be the only one at home and my net would be stable. Or I would stay up incredibly late until every had gone to sleep.

I just had a 13 minute loss because some jackass Irelia never connected to the game. RIP placement matches if this is what's going to happen without any moderation.

Pick who you want to play, lock in
Pick ban, lock in
Pick champ, still communicating with team about start of game
Forget to lock in

Happens twice, 30 min que timer. 
Come on Riot

I don't believe you need to lock in Pick intent

Only lock in your ban and lock in your pick.
